page.title: 20The Return. (a poem)
page.content:
headland The young wheat is green on the ^ The west wind blows clean on my brow, The road that goes down to the valley Leads back to the farm and the plough.
The cattle are grazing the meadow, The streamlet runs merrily still, And all that men long for in exile, Nestles here in the fold of the hill.
The home of my childhood is waiting To welcome me in from the night; I know the old dog will remember And whimper and wag with delight.
Yet,sad I go down to the homestead, Not gaily as I used to do; For never again shall I find there The dear kind hearts that I knew. {Frank Mansell}
